newsitem.title: CANADA: Suncor board okays two-for-one stock split.
newsitem.headline: Suncor board okays two-for-one stock split.

text.p: Suncor Inc said its board of directors approved a two-for-one stock split of Suncor's issued and outstanding common shares.
Suncor's president and chief executive Richard George said the share split should enhance market liquidity and promote more retail investment in the company.

"We're proud that our share price has risen steadily since the initial offering," said George. "Splitting the shares should increase trading activity and encourage wider ownership of our shares. The lower price per share will also make it easier for smaller investors to purchase Suncor stock."
Since it became a public company in 1992, Suncor's share price has risen from C$19 to a closing price of C$62.65 per share at the end of trading on January 23.
Shareholder approval of the stock split will be sought at Suncor's upcoming annual meeting, slated for April 17.
Suncor said the official date of the proposed split will be announced prior to the meeting.
The split will not change the rights of holders of common shares, Suncor said.
